intro: Mycetia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered mycetia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Caesalpiniaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, with five petals, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Mycetia parviflora is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
